questiontext.text: 1. There has been an accident that a commercial plane crashed and caught fire in the mountainous area of Kalimantan. The DVI TEAM was immediately dispatched to identify the dead victims armed with the plane's manifest data. What does "identification" mean in the above case?

answer.text: Work together between teams to find victims
Checking the condition of the victim if any matches the manifest
Matching the identity of the victim through fingerprints, teeth, DNA
Record the number and condition of the victims at the scene

questiontext.text: 2. A Twin Otter airplane “Merpati Air” en route to Tana Toraja on June 28, 2017, the aircraft crashed due to engine failure and crashed on the slopes of Mount Bambapuang Enrekang. The DVI FKG Unhas team immediately headed to the scene to identify the victim.

answer.text: The family's desire to bury the body

questiontext.text: 3. There has been an accident that a commercial plane crashed and caught fire due to crashing into one of the mountains in Jaya Wijaya. The plane was carrying several foreign tourists. To facilitate the identification process to determine the race of the victim, an examination is carried out by looking at the characteristic presence of a shovel shape on the teeth. Characteristics of shovel shape teeth can be seen on the teeth:

4. A group of mountain climbers found the skeleton of a human skull in a wilderness. They reported the incident to the local police. By police officers the skull skeleton was brought to Rs. Consider for further inspection. On the other hand, previously at the Police Station, there were reports that 3 families had lost their family members. The family has deposited data in the form of photos of the missing family members. For the identification process, the Forensic Team can use the CranioFacial Superimposition Technique, namely:

answer.text: Comparing the panoramic x ray of the victim with the photo of the victimobtained from the family
Reshape the victim's face by comparing it with the face of his family
Comparing the victim's skull with the photo of the victim's face provided by the family
Comparing the skull of the victim with the face of his family to find the correlation
Comparing the victim's photo with the victim's skull photo

questiontext.text: 5. During a night operation, carried out by Sabhara Polrestabes Makassar troops at Pasar Daya Field, the body of an unknown woman was found with bite marks on the arm and chest, the police had difficulty analyzing the bite and were consulted with the forensic team of the FK & FKG Unhas who were asked to came to the crime scene to help the police solve the case. The first action that the Forensic Team takes at a crime scene is:

answer.text: Take a swab on the bite wound
Make a sketch of a crime scene, photos of other injuries
Take a full body photo, then a close up photo of the bite marks
Record the shape and depth of the bite wound.

questiontext.text: 6. One night, by Sabhara Polresta Makassar troops in Pasar Daya Field, a woman known as a worker on the chest arm, the police found out about this and were consulted with the forensic team of FK & FKG Unhas asked to come to the TKP to help the police uncover the case. Bite Scars are:

answer.text: Signs / injuries that appear on the corpse that was bitten by the perpetrator
The visible scars in rape cases
Visible marks on the victim's body
Injuries produced by people or animals on the skin of others
Visible marks or scars on the victim's body

questiontext.text: 7. A patient came to the dentist with a complaint of swollen gums since 2 days ago, this abnormality is accompanied by intermittent pain. On oral examination, it was found that in addition to swelling, the gums were also slightly reddish compared to the surrounding gums. In this condition of swollen gums, what fluid is experiencing an increase in volume?

8. A man aged 25 years is a resident of an apartment in Jakarta. He has been found unconscious in his apartment by a cleaning service. The victim was taken to the hospital to be examined and treated by a doctor. What signs can confirm that the man is dead?

9. A patient comes to the dentist with a complaint of swollen gums since 2 days ago, this abnormality is accompanied by intermittent pain. On oral examination, it was found that in addition to swelling, the gums were also slightly reddish compared to the surrounding gums. What is the right term to describe the redness of the gums?

10. A dentist examines a patient and finds red spots that are about 2 mm in size. in the buccal area of the oral mucosa. What is the correct term for abnormalities in the form of bleeding spots in the area?

11. A patient is referred to a central hospital because he is unconscious. On physical examination, this patient had a high temperature, low blood pressure and weak pulse. Based on information from the family, this patient had suffered injuries to his arm but was left alone. The condition that occurs in these patients is known as:

12. A patient is referred to a central hospital because he is unconscious. On physical examination, this patient had a high temperature, low blood pressure and weak pulse. Based on information from the family, this patient had suffered injuries to his arm but was left alone. The cause of this shock is due to infection from the following agents:

13. An adult cranium was found with teeth that had fallen out of the socket of the cranium. Based on the anatomical description of various aspects and the differences in the characteristics possessed, students can easily identify each tooth correctly. Identification and estimation of age through dentition examination, which is not recommended by the Gustaffson method:

14. It is found adult cranium with complete teeth. Based on the anatomical description of various aspects and the differences in the characteristics possessed, students can easily identify each tooth correctly. The complete growth of the root of the tooth in the cranium lasts 1-5 years before eruption

15. In a Mass Disaster event of a plane crash, there are many victims to be identified. Dentists can be involved in the DVI process by identifying their teeth. Teeth that are detached from the victim's jaw can be identified by the type of teeth through their anatomical shape. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the morphological characteristics of mandibular molars?

answer.text: When viewed from the mesial/distal point of view, the crown is square
Have 4 or 5 cusps of the same size
The mesio-distal size is larger than the bucco-lingual size

questiontext.text: 16. It is found 4 child skulls from 6 mutilated child victims. Age identification and estimation will be carried out based on the panoramic images made. Age analysis methods that are not suitable for use in the identification process of the above cases are:
17. In studies conducted for age assessment using panoramic radiographs, inclusion criteria should be established, which include the following inclusion criteria:

18. Clinically, permanent dentition is complete at the eruption of the third molars at 17-21 years of age, after which radiographic age estimation becomes difficult. The common methods used for adults to assess third molar growth are:
19. In assessing age from a panoramic view, the pulp chamber is one of the indicators. One of the methods used is Tooth Coronal Index - Coronal Pulp Cavity. The teeth most commonly used are:

20. The body of a 19-year-old woman has been found in the forest without an identity. The skin of the victim's body closely resembled that of a white person and on examination of the victim's teeth, a clear spade-shaped cingulum and marginal ridge were found on the palatal parts of the maxillary teeth. The characteristics of the teeth can be used as a primary identification tool.

21. There has been an accident that a commercial plane crashed and caught fire in the mountainous area of Kalimantan. The DVI TEAM was immediately dispatched to identify the dead victims armed with the plane's manifest data. What does "identification" mean in the above case?

answer.text: Work together between teams to find victims
Checking the condition of the victim if any matches the manifest
Matching the identity of the victim through fingerprints, teeth, DNA
Record the number and condition of the victims at the scene

questiontext.text: 22. There has been a fire in a densely populated residential area in Kec. Biringka. As a result of this fire, 3 people died. The victim was no longer recognized because the entire body was burned to the ground leaving only bones and skulls. For the identification process, a post mortem is recorded in the morgue. To complete the data, Ronsen's photo was taken. One of the functions of the Ronsen Post Mortem photo is:

23. A twin otter plane was reported to have had an accident en route to Sentani. The plane crashed and caught fire. From the TKP team report, it is known that all the crew and passengers of the plane were killed, with the condition of the victim being burned to the point of charred. The DVI team, assisted by a joint FK-FKG Unhas team, was immediately dispatched to assist in the identification process. What is the most likely identification method in this case?

24. A TNI Latif plane was reported to have crashed after hitting a mountain. The DVI team immediately set up an Ante Mortem data post at the airport closest to the incident location. What does 'Ante Mortem Data' mean in the above case?

answer.text: Fill in the Interpol yellow DVI form
Collecting data and information on victims during their lifetime from the family
Information center on victims from local government
List of names of airline passengers from airlines
Filling out the Pink DVI Interpol form

questiontext.text: 25. There has been a fire in a densely populated residential area which destroyed dozens of houses and killed several residents because it occurred at night when the residents were fast asleep. Because the condition of the victim has been charred, only the bones are left, so the identification process can be used by examining the condition of his teeth. Teeth are a means of identification because:

answer.text: The structure of the teeth is different from solid bone
It is easy to distinguish between natural teeth and dentures
Teeth are the hardest tissue in the body
Everyone has their own teeth and jaw shape
Each tooth is easily distinguished by the shape of its root and crown

questiontext.text: 26. A victim of a plane crash that crashed and exploded in a coastal area. The investigative team who arrived at the scene did not find an intact body. One of the body fragments found was part of the right lower jaw bone. All ante mortem radiographic data of the victim has been recorded to determine the identity of the victim. Next, a postmortem radiograph will be taken. Forensic odontology team to take photos using what technique is appropriate?

27. There has been a fire in the Tallo area. This incident claimed the lives of 5 residents. Victims are difficult to identify because everything has been burned. One of the victims named ST (23 years old) was informed by his family that he had a history of going to a doctor with treatment data for amalgam fillings on tooth 24 and Composite fillings on lower left tooth 36. Identification of victims using data from dental radiographs is called:

28. There has been a fire in the Tallo area. This incident claimed the lives of 5 residents. Victims are difficult to identify because everything has been burned. One of the victims named ST (23 years old) was informed by his family that he had a history of going to a doctor with treatment data for amalgam fillings on tooth 24 and Composite fillings on lower left tooth 36. If the victim is X-rayed to obtain Post Mortem data, the tooth that has been filled will show the following picture:

29. In a case of a plane crash that crashes and catches fire, it always kills all passengers and crew. Because the victim's condition was guessed and the limbs were crushed, the identification process was rather difficult. However, if the victim has complete data during his lifetime (AM) it will facilitate and assist the Identification Process to facilitate the identification of victims in the above cases, data are needed, including:

30. According to Gustafo, teeth are the hardest structure in the human body because they are protected by soft tissues and bones so they are protected from damage and can withstand higher temperatures. Even if burned and charred by fire, the roots can still be used for identification. That is why teeth are so important in the forensic identification process. Investigations show that teeth will decay and turn to ash at what temperature?

answer.text: Weathered at 3000F and turns to ash at 7000F
Weathered at 3700F and become ash at 7500F
Weathered at 4000F and turned to ash at 8000F
Weathered at 4000F and turned to ash at 9000F
Weathered at 4500F and turn to ash at 9500F

questiontext.text: 31. A victim of a sinking ship was found in the waters by a fisherman. The body was taken to the nearest hospital for an autopsy. After knowing the dentist who often treats him. Ante mortem data were obtained for horizontally impacted tooth 23 with the root pointing towards the palate. What Post Mortem photo technique will be used so that it is the same as the antemortem photo of the corpse?
32. Medical records are kept in a special room and kept confidential by the hospital. Due to limited storage space, the hospital will destroy unused medical records.

33. Every practice health service unit or hospital is required to provide medical records for patients and is regulated by law. If there is a violation where the service unit or practice does not have a medical record, then according to the legislation can be threatened with imprisonment and a fine?

answer.text: 0. 5 years and a fine of Rp. 25,000,000
1 year and a fine of IDR 50,000,000
1. 5 years and a fine of IDR 75,000,000
years and a fine of IDR 100,000,000
2. 5 years and a fine of Rp. 125,000,000

questiontext.text: 34. To perform medical treatment on a patient, the patient is required to fill out the Inform Consent related to the patient's consent.

answer.text: Treatments that have been carried out

questiontext.text: 35. Before the patient is treated in a health service place, such as a hospital, health center, clinic and private practice place, a medical record must be made. Medical Records are filled in by a doctor or dentist in accordance with their authority and competence. The usefulness of the Medical Record above is in accordance with the aspect of?

36. A 25-year-old man diagnosed with HIV filed a lawsuit in court against the hospital where a year earlier he had a tooth extracted. The examination was carried out on medical personnel and clinical procedures applied in the hospital. What form of malpractice is most likely to be found in connection with the above case?

answer.text: Dentist SIP and STR are no longer valid
Repeated use of syringes and refillable injection tubes
Uncomfortable practice room, without adequate ventilation
Extraction is performed by a non-Oral Surgeon Specialist Dentist

questiontext.text: 37. A beautiful 26-year-old artist underwent orthodontic treatment with orthodontic devices at the RSGM Orthodontic clinic. Panoramic photos he uses beauty implants. A few months later news broke that he was using a beauty implant. He felt wronged and sued the doctor who treated him. What medical malpractice occurred in the above case?

answer.text: Breach of promise of medical action

questiontext.text: 38. A 19-year-old woman underwent orthodontic treatment at the General Hospital with a case of a normal central diastem and frenulum. X-ray photo not done. On the 15th control, the diastem width does not decrease. It is not known what the real resistance to diastem closure is. Treatment failure in the above cases, it can be said as:

39. A 25 year old male patient came to the General Hospital with a complaint that he wanted his teeth extracted. For reasons of savings, the dentist performs local anesthesia for only half an ampoule. When the tooth was extracted, the patient screamed in pain, but the dentist continued with the procedure until the tooth was extracted. What type of malpractice is associated with the above case?

answer.text: There is no element of malpractice

questiontext.text: 40. A dentist suspected of malpractice shall undergo a hearing on the Honorary Council for the Discipline of Indonesian Dentistry (MKDKGI). MKDKGI decided that there had been administrative malpractice. What are the possible offenses committed to be found guilty?

answer.text: Application of SOP Medical action is not correct
Filing of patient data that is not neat.
Medical records are not yet computerized

questiontext.text: 41. A 21-year-old woman came to the General Hospital with a complaint of incomplete maxillary teeth. On clinical examination showed that tooth 23 had not erupted. The results of the panoramic photo examination showed 23 impacted teeth. The results of the diagnosis of Angle Class I malocclusion, accompanied by impacted teeth 23. In the above case, what information should be conveyed to the patient prior to the treatment of the impacted tooth:

42. A 21-year-old woman came to the General Hospital with a complaint of incomplete maxillary teeth. On clinical examination showed that tooth 23 had not erupted. The results of the panoramic photo examination showed 23 impacted teeth. The results of the diagnosis of Angle Class I malocclusion, accompanied by impacted teeth 23. In the above case, the information conveyed to the patient prior to the treatment of the impacted tooth was:

43. A mother took her 10-year-old daughter to the RSGM to have her teeth checked. After examination, the doctor found a large hole in tooth 46, accompanied by swelling of the gums at the root of the tooth. Due to the condition of the tooth, it could no longer be treated, so the doctor recommended to just pull it out. Before the tooth was extracted the doctor gave an informed consent form to be filled out by the patient's mother. Benefits of Informed Consent in the above cases:

answer.text: Maintain the patient's relationship with the doctor
Make it easier for patients to file a lawsuit

questiontext.text: 44. A 21-year-old man was brought to the RSGM for the Emergency Unit because he had a motor vehicle accident. General condition was good, clinical examination showed trauma to the anterior maxilla and mandible, teeth 11 and 21 were avulsed. In the above case, the consent for the action that was proposed to the patient before it was carried out could be in the form of:

45. One of the legal grounds for procuring a Visum et Repertum (VER) is based on Article 133 paragraph 1 of the Criminal Procedure Code which states that an investigator for the purposes of the judiciary handles a victim suspected of having an incident which constitutes a criminal act, he is authorized to submit a request for expert testimony to a forensic doctor, doctor or other experts. hat is the role of VER in the process of proving a criminal case?

answer.text: Instructions for the suspect to be detained

questiontext.text: 46. A woman, 16 years old, reported to the police as a victim of acts of physical violence she experienced from her own uncle who lived with the victim. To complete the evidence, the doctor was asked to make a VER and one of the findings was bite marks on the victim's body. What is the part of the VER that writes the doctor's opinion for the wound analysis in this case?

47. A man, 25 years old, was brought to the emergency room of the hospital because of lacerations to his face and mouth, then his family reported him to the police as a victim of an alleged beating, and the investigator asked the doctor to make a post-mortem as complete evidence. Is part of the VER as strong evidence/medical facts that contain implicit reasoning for the benefit of the judiciary?

48. A dentist puts a billboard in front of the practice's nameplate, which conveys the type and quality of care carried out in his practice. Although the information submitted is in accordance with the actual conditions. The doctor committed a category violation:

49. A dentist puts a billboard next to the practice's nameplate, which conveys the type and quality of care carried out in his practice. The information submitted is in accordance with the actual conditions. n the case above, the professional organization bodies that should handle are:
50. A dentist who temporarily practices at X-Hospital, just realized that his STR had expired 1 year ago. What action should the doctor take?

answer.text: Immediately take care of the STR extension file through the local branch 3KGB PDGI unit
Immediately take care of the STR extension file through the local P3KGB PDGI team
Immediately take care of the STR extension file through the P3KGB PB PDGI commission
Register to take the UKDGI exam

questiontext.text: 51. A dentist who temporarily practices at Hospital - X, just realized that his STR had expired 1 year ago. In order to legally carry out professional actions, the doctor can take care of Temporary SIP at the authorized institution. In managing the Temporary SIP, a letter of recommendation is required. Who has the right to give the recommendation letter?

52. A dentist wrote on his practice board as follows: “Serving the manufacture of dentures, cleaning tartar, tooth extraction, filling teeth”. Against these violations, competent agencies in order are:

53. A dentist will attend a scientific seminar abroad for 1 week. Therefore, while leaving the practice, he delegated his dental practice activities to his senior dental nurse. In this regard, which of the following statements is true?

answer.text: The action is justified because he has given training to the senior nurse.
Such action can be justified as long as it is informed to the patient.
The dentist has committed an ethical violation
The dentist has committed a disciplinary violation
The dentist has committed a criminal offense

questiontext.text: 54. Indonesian Dentist Competency Standards (SKDGI) are used in the preparation of the dental professional education curriculum so that the outputs produced have the same minimum standards/ability to practice as a dentist professionally throughout the territory of the Republic of Indonesia. One of the competency domains that is of great concern is the domain of professionalism, of course without ignoring the importance of other competency domains in SKDGI. hat is the legal basis used in the preparation of these standards?

answer.text: Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 29 of 2004
Law of the Republic of Indonesia No. 20 Year 2013
Indonesian Medical Council Regulation No. 40 Year 2015
Indonesian Medical Council Regulation No. 23 Year 2006
Regulation of the Minister of National Education of the Republic of Indonesia Number 30 of 2013

questiontext.text: 55. Indonesian Dentist Competency Standards (SKDGI) are used in the preparation of the dental profession education curriculum so that the output produced has the same minimum standard/ability to be able to practice as a dentist professionally throughout the territory of the Republic of Indonesia. One of the competency domains that is of great concern is the domain of professionalism, of course without ignoring the importance of other competency domains in SKDGI. hat other competency domains are meant?

answer.text: Critical, scientific and effective analysis of health information
Socio-cultural relations in the field of dental and oral health
Restoration of the function of the stomatognathic system

questiontext.text: 56. Indonesian Dentist Competency Standards (SKDGI) are used in the preparation of the dental professional education curriculum so that the output produced has the same minimum standard/ability to be able to practice as a dentist professionally throughout the territory of the Republic of Indonesia. One of the competency domains that is of great concern is the domain of professionalism. What are the most appropriate core competencies in the realm of professionalism?

57. Dental students undergoing professional dental education must be equipped with the ability to recognize and understand problems related to the laws that apply to the health care system in Indonesia. These competencies have been regulated in the SKDGI. This is important in order to prevent and protect themselves as dentists, patients and their families from potential violations in dental practice. What is the most appropriate type of core competency regarding the above?

58. In providing services to patients, data and information are needed that are used as a basic reference in carrying out oral dental care and the needs of forensic dentistry. This data is also a mandatory document for the Dental and Oral Hospital. What is the most appropriate type of basic data in the above statement?

59. An alumnus of the State Faculty of Dentistry in Indonesia, conducts dental practice without having a practice permit. During his practice of dentistry, he was found to have committed malpractice. The laws governing malpractice are:

60. A dentist performs a tooth extraction procedure, but as a result the tooth extraction is bleeding profusely and has to be hospitalized. It was later discovered that the dentist performed the procedure without asking the patient's consent. Including what malpractice happened in the above case?
61. Dentists in carrying out dental practice must meet the approval of dental procedures. The agreement includes

answer.text: Diagnosis, benefits of type of treatment, best course of action, less risk and good prognosis
Diagnosis, lack of type of treatment, best course of action, reduced risk of treatment and good prognosis
Diagnosis, purpose of action, alternative actions, risks and complications, and prognosis
Diagnosis, without explaining the type of treatment, determines the best course of action, minimal risk and poor prognosis
Diagnosis, without explaining the type of treatment, determines the best course of action, risks and complications and the prognosis cannot be predicted

questiontext.text: 62. One of the higher education foundations opened a faculty of dentistry in an area. The opening of the faculty of dentistry must comply with Law no. 20 of 2013 and Government Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia No. 52 of 2017. In establishing the faculty of dentistry the establishment must comply with Article 3, Government Regulation of the Republic of Indonesia No. 52 Year 2017

answer.text: The universities mentioned above are required to open a medical study program
The universities mentioned above are required to open a dental study program
Faculty of medicine cannot open a dental study program
The Faculty of Dentistry can open a medical study program
The universities mentioned above are not required to submit an application for the opening of a dental study program to the Minister

questiontext.text: 63. Government regulations regarding implementing regulations of Law no. 20 of 2017 concerning dental education, Article 2 regulates

answer.text: The Faculty of Dentistry is a collection of supporting resources for higher education institutions that organize and manage dentistry education
Teaching hospital is a hospital that has a function as a place of education
Dental education facility is a facility other than a teaching hospital that is used as a place for holding dental education
Establishment of medical faculty, faculty of dentistry and addition of study programs

questiontext.text: 64. In the practice of dentistry, the relationship between dentist and patient is regulated by a code of ethics and the medical legal system. In health law, the term trilogy is known in the medical field which contains:

answer.text: Standard procedures, service standards, and medical standards
Informed consent, medical records, and medical confidentiality
Informed consent, Medical Secrets, and Medical Ethics Code
Medical Ethics, Doctor's Oath, Medical Law

questiontext.text: 65. A 60-year-old male patient came for treatment and consultation at the RSGM. After an examination by drg. Sp. BM found signs of a malignant tumor on his tongue. It was explained to the patient that now the tumor is stage 4 with the possibility that surgery can no longer be carried out so as not to worsen the patient's condition. The doctor suggested chemotherapy. The doctor-patient relationship includes:

66. A 30-year-old woman comes to the doctor's office with the intention of having her teeth extracted. After a dental examination and X-ray of the tooth to be extracted, it turned out that there was a cyst at the tip of the root. After being given an explanation by the drg about what treatment was best for the patient, it was finally decided to perform tooth extraction treatment while simultaneously removing the cyst so that the treatment provided by the patient was maximal and for the good of the patient. This doctor-patient relationship is called:

67. A patient came for treatment at the RSGM and was accompanied by several friends. After examination, it was found that the patient had an ameloblastoma in his jaw. The doctor explains how the diagnosis, and the patient's treatment plan to the patient. And before explaining all the conditions of the disease, the doctor invites the patient's friends to leave the room and does not listen to the doctor's explanation. The doctor-patient relationship carried out by the doctor is:

68. A female patient came for treatment at the RSGM. After examination, it turned out that the patient had an infection in the buccal region. The doctor explains the diagnosis and treatment plan. The doctor explains all about the disease and complications including the risks that will occur honestly and openly to the patient. And the patient agrees on what action the doctor will take. The relationship between doctor and patient that is carried out by both is:

69. A patient came to be escorted by an angkot driver after falling from a motorbike and was unconscious so he was taken to the RSGM ER. From the information of the angkot driver that the patient has been unconscious since a few minutes ago. After an examination, the patient has stopped breathing and the doctor must immediately provide assistance to the patient without waiting for the family's approval. What is the basic pattern of relationship between doctor and patient at that time:

70. A 38-year-old male patient came to have his teeth checked. His history of dental treatment 2 years ago was filled with amalgam. Then a year ago it broke and the doctor decided root canal treatment. The doctor explained about the condition of the tooth that the remaining roots could be extracted or further treatment was carried out. The patient consciously decided to have the tooth extracted. What is the basic pattern of relationship between doctor and patient at that time:

71. A patient aged 65 years, came to the Puskesmas, he lived at an address far from a specialist doctor's facility, wanted to treat teeth 36. Extra-oral and intra-oral examinations showed no abnormalities, except for tooth 36 which had deep caries, the rest of the crown was still more of 2/3 crown. The doctor who treated him pulled the tooth even though the patient did not agree, the reason the doctor said that the endodontic treatment place was far from the city. Are the ethical principles that the doctor violated are:

72. A patient aged 50 years, came to the dentist to have his tooth extracted, the dentist performed the extraction on tooth 15 with a hopeless condition, the tooth was indeed an indication for extraction. However, shortly after the patient was anesthetized, the patient experienced convulsions, although after a while the patient regained consciousness. After anamnesis again, it turns out that the patient suffers from epilepsy. The doctor who treated and extracted the tooth violated ethical principles:

73. A 65-year-old patient came to the health center to remove 37 tooth with residual roots, 3rd degree tooth root and disturbing the patient during mastication. From the history, the dentist knew that the patient had chronic tuberculosis. The dentist gave a prescription and referred him to an oral surgeon. The patient objected and felt that he was not being served properly. Violations that the dentist does not extract the tooth are:

74. A dentist who has just finished his medical education and has received STR, but already has complete practice facilities to carry out specialized practice. A patient came who required specialist treatment on tooth 27, and was an indication for endodontic treatment. What the doctor should do is:

answer.text: Work on the case immediately because it is supported by adequate equipment
Delaying while waiting for the endodontic course to be completed
Immediately refer the patient to a conservation dentist
Calling a more senior dentist to help with the case
The dentist treats with the help of a guide for the intended dental care

questiontext.text: 75. A patient comes to the Puskesmas to have a back filling checked. The patient complained of pain in a tooth that had been filled 3 years ago at the same health center. After examination, it was found that the patient's tooth had secondary caries that reached the root and had to be extracted. The dentist who performed the treatment then filled in the patient's medical record and odontogram. What is the most appropriate filling in the odontogram in the above case?

answer.text: Create a new odontogram on the patient
Continue to fill in the patient's old odontogram column
Write the name and initials of the treating dentist on the odontogram sheet
Write the date and initials on the odontogram sheet
Do not make changes to the odontogram until the definitive treatment is complete

questiontext.text: 76. A patient comes to the dentist's office to examine the lower back teeth that have been filled with frequent pain. After the examination, it appears that the amalgam class 2 restoration of tooth 46. The dentist then dismantled the old restoration and then performed root canal treatment. What is the most appropriate filling in the odontogram in the above case?

answer.text: Create a new odontogram on the patient
Continue to fill in the patient's old odontogram column
Write the name and initials of the treating dentist on the odontogram sheet
Write the date and initials on the odontogram sheet
Do not make changes to the odontogram until definitive treatment is complete

questiontext.text: 77. In accordance with SK PB PDGI No: SKEP/3573PB PDGI/VIII/2015, filling out the odontrogram in the Medical Record of Dentistry uses abbreviations and symbols that follow general and special provisions. As a note from the provisions on the use of abbreviations and symbols, when using color as a restoration code, it is applied as follows:

answer.text: Ordinary metal restoration with pink color
Amalgam filling according to gray/silver color
A filling with the same color as the tooth color : green

questiontext.text: 78. Along with the development of technology, in the IT field, the use of medical records written in electronic media makes it easier for dentists to:

answer.text: Can be copied and transferred because it is not a medical secret
Visual identification of patients for practical purposes
Does not require large storage space
Easy to delete if there is a typo

questiontext.text: 79. In a fire incident in a densely populated village, dozens of houses were burned and 10 people died. One of the victims was treated by a doctor so that Ante Mortem data was obtained in the form of a Dental Record. The following is an overview of the odontrogram. Based on the odontogram above, this victim:

answer.text: Has one impacted tooth that is not visible in the mouth
This patient has a full cast crown

questiontext.text: 80. In accordance with SK PB PDGI No: SKEP/3573PB PDGI/VIII/2015, filling out the odontrogram in the Medical Record of Dentistry uses abbreviations and symbols that follow general and special provisions. Based on these general provisions, the most appropriate statement below is:

answer.text: Surface/location/position of caries or filling must be filled in: M, O, D, B, L
Metal or amalgam restorations are used in black and white
The inlay is described as the same as the patch
Restoration of teeth is used in green
